verses.name: Job 4:8
verses.text: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.

verses.name: Job 4:9
verses.text: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.

verses.name: Job 4:10
verses.text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

verses.name: Job 4:11
verses.text: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion’s whelps are scattered abroad.

verses.name: Job 4:12
verses.text: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.

verses.name: Job 4:13
verses.text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,
